title: Two students set fire to school principal’s office in revenge over punishment
body_lines: Two students at a school in Keselwatta, Panadura had allegedly set fire to the school principal's office and computer room following an argument with the principal, police investigations revealed.
Police said the Panadura North Police had launched an investigation following a tip off that a fire had broken out at Sri Jina Dharmadana Vidyalaya in Keselwatta, Panadura yesterday.
The fire damaged the school principal's office and computer room.
Investigations using CCTV footage of the crime had revealed that two students, aged 12 and 7, who were studying at the same school were responsible for the incident.
They informed the police that the reason for the arson was anger with the principal as the principal had punished them over some wrongdoing.
The two students are to be produced before the Panadura Magistrate's Court today.(Darshana Sanjeewa Balasuriya)
